docblock.long-description:
This model allows us to add, update, retrieve and delete category from category table.

It uses the following tables:

  • Category
  • Field (read only)
  • User (read only)
  • Question (read only)
This function will add new category to a specified field in Category tables and return category ID.
This function is used to update previouse existed category in a Category tables.

tag.name: return
tag.description: contains category object containing fieldID, catID and catName

docblock.long-description: This function is used to delete a specific category from a Category tables.

parse_markers.error: No DocBlock was found for method get_categories()

docblock.long-description:
Provides CRUD functionality for questions.

It uses the following database tables:

  • Question
  • Answer (read only)

docblock.description: retrieve a sorted and paginated question list
docblock.long-description:
Returns all comments for a question, providing the userName of the commenter and the body of the comment.

The array $filter can be used to filter the result according to certain criteria. The array may contain the following keys:

  • userID: show only questions posted by a certain user id
  • catID: show only questions in a specific category id
  • search: a search term as a string. Words separated by a whitespace are ANDed.

Usage Example: get the first 10 questions matching the terms php and apache :

get_list(0, 10, array('search'=>'php apache')) get the questions 6-10 with catId 4 get_list(5, 10, array('category'=>4))

tag.name: param
tag.description: the amount of questions to retrieve

tag.name: param
tag.description: the optional filter to be applied to the results

tag.name: return
tag.description: holds question objects with a questionID and its title

docblock.description: count the questions matching a certain filter.
docblock.long-description: the total amount of questions matching the filter criteria. see get_list documentation for details.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the optional filter, see the get_list documentation

docblock.description: all the information about one question.
docblock.long-description: the total amount of questions matching the filter criteria. see get_list documentation for details.

tag.name: return
tag.description: a single question object, containing column values as attributes.

docblock.long-description:
Allows to retrieve and post comments for questions and answers.

It uses the following database tables:

  • Comment
  • User (read only)
Returns all comments for a question, providing the userName of the commenter and the body of the comment.

tag.description: holds comment objects with userName and body properties

docblock.long-description: Handles the basic admin functionality. List Users,upgrade usere's privileges, delete users, update users data,add new user, list onsite users

this funciton will check the userdata from session,if the user is admin it will access the admin table if not will redirect to main/home view

this function is for upgrading user privileges as per admin decision from one level to other
this function will load the view that will show the user name of the online user and the ip fro un registerd user
this function will load the addUser view for adding user data and than load the addUser function to store the data in to the database
this function is to create new user it will get the data for user from the addUser view and send to data base
this function will show details of the user with id specifyed as parameter
this function will retrive existing data for a user with given id $id for updating and will load the data in the update view
this function will update the information of the person with new inserted data from the view and save to the database
this function delete the user with _$id_from user table
set validation rule for inserted data in the text field of veiw

docblock.long-description: Handles logging in and registering users.
loads: user_model, main_lang

docblock.description: private helper function to build view
docblock.long-description: This loads views for the registration, failed-login, etc. screens

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data array to pass on to the views

docblock.long-description: This function check the following condition, and perform the task Getting values (username, password) from login form and checking it in database also login form have an optional checkbox field (remember) this function also check if someone checked this remember checkbox, so it will create a cookie on client computer which will be exist till 3 days, otherwise cookies will be delete if user login failed so a failed(username) function will be called and this failed fuction is counting that how much time login is failed if it was more than 3 times and new recover page will open to user. if user login successfully session data will be set for this user where userid, username, usertype, login(true, false) will store when user data set in the sessioin the user will be redirect to the last visiting place which will take from session data. (last_visited)
Session data of the current user will unset here: login userid(uid) usertype username will redirect after loging out, to the last visited place

This funciton is for counting user login failing and to show login failed page, or account recover page It checks wheather the failed_logins variable set in the session data or not if not, it make a failed_logins index and storing 1st time login fail or if the failed_logins was already set in the session data it just increment it (last_value + 1) than it set a data array to store error and username there, This function also check if the user login failed less than 3 times it will redirect to the login_failed page and if the login failed 3 times it will redirect user to recover page, where he/she can recoreved his/her password

tag.name: Note
tag.description: : Error message taken from Language helper class, lang('message_index'); it return the specified error message in current language.

markers.todo: Document the login(), logout() and failed() function. Change the implementation of failed() so it accepts only 3 failed password logins. After the third failed login the user should be sent to the recover page (user/recover/$username).
